articles.headline: Al Qaeda Coldly Acknowledges Obama Victory
articles.snippet: Al Qaeda’s deputy, Ayman al-Zawahri, sought to dampen enthusiasm for Barack Obama’s election by saying that the “new face” of America only masked a “heart full of hate.”
articles.abstract: Al Qaeda’s deputy, Ayman al-Zawahri, sought to dampen enthusiasm for Barack Obama’s election by saying that the “new face” of America only masked a “heart full of hate.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In a propaganda salvo by Al Qaeda aimed at undercutting the enthusiasm of Muslims worldwide about the American election, Osama bin Laden’s top deputy condemned President-elect Barack Obama as a “house Negro” who would continue a campaign against Islam that Al Qaeda’s leaders said was begun by President Bush.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Scott Shane

articles.headline: For Studio, Vampire Movie Is a Cinderella Story
articles.snippet: Tiny Summit Entertainment finds itself sitting atop one of the biggest pop-culture phenomena of recent years.
articles.abstract: Tiny Summit Entertainment finds itself sitting atop one of the biggest pop-culture phenomena of recent years.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Until now, tiny Summit Entertainment has been largely ignored by the major studios and looked down on by A-list agents and managers. But because of a classic bit of Hollywood bungling, the fledgling movie company finds itself sitting atop one of the biggest pop-culture phenomena of recent years.

articles.headline: HD Video Made Sleek and Simple
articles.snippet: Pure Digital has added high definition to its Flip Mino, which is already called the least-expensive, smallest and fastest camcorder on the market.
articles.abstract: Pure Digital has added high definition to its Flip Mino, which is already called the least-expensive, smallest and fastest camcorder on the market.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a tech reviewer, my pulse races whenever a product is introduced with superlatives attached. “Fastest.” “Smallest.” “Thinnest.” It makes my day; I’ve got my news angle built right in.

articles.headline: Web Sites Wage Holiday Price Wars
articles.snippet: As deserted malls and department stores struggle to court consumers with steep discounts, an even more ferocious price war is being waged online.
articles.abstract: As deserted malls and department stores struggle to court consumers with steep discounts, an even more ferocious price war is being waged online.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  As deserted malls and department stores struggle to court cash-short consumers with steep discounts this holiday season, a similar and even more ferocious price war is being waged online.
articles.byline: By Claire Cain Miller and Brad Stone

articles.headline: Stocks Drop Sharply and Credit Markets Seize Up
articles.snippet: As a new bout of fear gripped the financial markets, stocks fell sharply again, and the credit markets seized up as confidence in the nation’s financial system ebbed.
articles.abstract: As a new bout of fear gripped the financial markets, stocks fell sharply again, and the credit markets seized up as confidence in the nation’s financial system ebbed.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a new bout of fear gripped the financial markets, stocks fell sharply again on Thursday, continuing a months-long plunge that has wiped out the gains of the last decade.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Jack Healy

articles.headline:
After Losses,
Pensions Ask
For a Change
articles.snippet: Some of the nation’s biggest companies want Congress to roll back rules requiring them to put more money into pension funds.
articles.abstract: Some of the nation’s biggest companies want Congress to roll back rules requiring them to put more money into pension funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stung by outsize investment losses, some of the nation’s biggest companies are pushing Congress to roll back rules requiring them to put more money into their pension funds, just two years after President Bush signed a law meant to strengthen the pension system.

articles.headline: Discussions With Clintons as Obama Creates Team
articles.snippet: Gov. Janet Napolitano of Arizona also emerged as a cabinet contender, but Penny Pritzker took herself out of the running.
articles.abstract: Gov. Janet Napolitano of Arizona also emerged as a cabinet contender, but Penny Pritzker took herself out of the running.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Former President Bill Clinton has agreed to all of the conditions sought by President-elect Barack Obama’s transition team to eliminate potential conflicts of interest if Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton becomes secretary of state, people close to the Clintons said Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: Oil Closes Below $50, Lowest Price Since May 2005
articles.snippet: After rising to dizzying heights this summer, the oil market is suffering a hair-raising drop.
articles.abstract: After rising to dizzying heights this summer, the oil market is suffering a hair-raising drop.
articles.lead_paragraph: After rising to dizzying heights this summer, the price of oil is in the middle of a hair-raising drop.
